text: Fläskkorv () is a Swedish sausage made largely or entirely from pork.Travel Stockholm, Sweden: An Illustrated Guide, Phrasebook, and Maps. Published. MobileReference, 2007. Traditionally it is sold raw (though now it is not uncommon to find precooked varieties), and often served during the Christmas smörgåsbord (Julbord). A typical accompaniment is rotmos, a dish made from mashed carrots, potatoes and rutabagas (swedes). ==See also== * List of sausages ==Notes== ==References== *This article incorporates text translated from the corresponding Swedish Wikipedia article as of 30 November 2008. Category:Swedish sausages
title: Fläskkorv
